programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Citizen vs. Con
programme.desc: Sometimes the bad guys are busted by regular people! These stories showcase good Samaritans stopping suspects in their tracks.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Cristina Quackenbush of Milkfish takes on Chef Jennifer Cole of Laurel Oak in a blindfold battle of international influences! They may not have matched on a dating app, but in the kitchen it’s a match-up for the ages.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate it, Pittsburgh!: Between The Bread
programme.desc: In honor of Pittsburgh's love of handhelds, Chef Claudy Pierre and Chef Alex Brown get creative crafting their best sandwich-inspired dishes.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.sub-title: Ballin' in Baltimore: Chic DJ Tiara LaNiece Schools Angel in Charm City Street Style
programme.desc: Angel suits up with Radio DJ and fashionista Tiara LaNiece. They grab one-of-a-kind threads you can only find in Charm City, dance with the city's best hip hop crew, stop for some sweet treats and create an incredible graffiti mural.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero takes to the streets to ask people about the wildest, wackiest news stories. In "Odd Jobs," contestants learn about a kid-run food truck, a school board member with a special license and a senior citizen that's into heavy work.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Cops & Robbers
programme.desc: From a coffeeshop chain to snowy railroad tracks, these unconventional crime scenes bring the childhood game of Cops & Robbers to life.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: Young Mom of Three a Nature Newbie
programme.desc: Ashley, 28, has spent 14 years raising her three children. Kinga comes to Manchester to get Ashley out into nature for the first time so she can share these experiences and pass them along to her children.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Hunt for the Daytona Beach Serial Killer
programme.desc: A serial killer preys on women from a hardscrabble section of Daytona Beach, Florida. Detectives have boxes of DNA and ballistic evidence. They just don't have a suspect.

programme.title: Underdog Uprising
programme.desc: Every game day, fans pour into the stands to cheer on New Mexico's soccer team. But these are no ordinary supporters. From the Curse, to Sektor 114, to the Black Diamonds these fans are making New Mexico United.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Hide & Seek
programme.desc: You can run. You can hide. But chances are, they’re still gonna find you. These are some of the wildest and most bizarre police captures on record.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.sub-title: Eat Play Stay: Embrace Your Wild Side in Omaha, NE
programme.desc: Dine alongside raccoons, feed your soul with road trip worthy comfort food, and see the art on the walls change as you sip a boozy milkshake. Then, zip and climb amongst the trees, and get "maaad" fit with a new goat-curls fitness routine.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.sub-title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.sub-title: Ed and Day in the ‘Burgh: Homestead’s Hidden Treasures
programme.desc: Ed and Day learn that in Homestead, looks can be deceiving. The guys throw axes in a bank, zip line in a church, and end the day with a beer at Duke's.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A missing Milwaukee woman's family and her community push for answers about her disappearance. What authorities learn a week later sends shockwaves through the city.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Meet a pair of dueling Creole dishes when Chef Eric Cook of Gris Gris battles it out against Chef Ericka Michelle Lassair of Diva Dawg. Will “Chef Diva’s” signature sauce stump her worthy opponent, or will “Cookie” manage to pull a rabbit out of a chef’s hat?

programme.title: Local Love
programme.sub-title: Local Love: Game-Loving Gal Pursues a Worthy Competitor
programme.desc: Sam from Salem is ready to fall under someone's spell. Which bachelor will charm his way into her heart?

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.sub-title: America's Most Delish Midwest: 10 Unexpected Eats with Midwest Flair
programme.desc: Uncover the Midwest's unexpected. From quirky to inventive flavor mash-ups like the bulgogi burger to the questionable sour cream & raisin pie, see how the area crafts some interesting but delightful culinary concoctions.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.sub-title: My Perfect Day with Woman's Day: Kind-Hearted 10-year-old Gets Showered With Thanks
programme.desc: Catalina, a 10-year-old community hero with a heart of gold spends her days giving back. Today, Meaghan surprises Catalina with a day of her own, from Sea adventures to a new set of wheels and more. It's her time to shine.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot: Marvel Actor, TikTok Fitness Mom, & Top Comedian Find Thrills at Theme Park
programme.desc: Our local experts know the best thrills at Fun Spot. Orlando’s top comedian braves the gravity-defying SkyCoaster, a monster DJ and actor can’t stop screaming on White Lightning, and an influencer leaves all her followers behind on the go-kart track.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Community members share their wisdom across generations. Both the young and old inspire each other, from dancers, to creators, veterans and everyday individuals.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.sub-title: Free Spirit : How Louisville is Blazing a New Bourbon Trail
programme.desc: Kate learns how to play a Germantown street game, gets up close and personal with handcrafted, hand-charred bourbon barrels, and learns to fall back in love with whiskey – and natural wine.

programme.title: Always Remember Your Name
programme.desc: A documentary of mistaken identity, hope, love, and the power of story by two Holocaust survivors.

programme.title: Chronicle: Quip Town
programme.desc: (2024) An all-access look at the Aliquippa high school football team's journey to repeat as state champions, from training camp through the season, all while battling numerous obstacles.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: One Pill Can Kill
programme.desc: Told through the voices of grieving parents, this documentary follows the real and lasting impact of the fentanyl crisis. Capturing the aftermath of sudden loss, the search for answers, and the transformation of grief into public advocacy.

programme.title: Chronicle: Pittsburgh After Dark
programme.desc: (2024) In this episode of "Chronicle," we're going to look at the side of Pittsburgh you don't normally see: When the sun does down and the moon comes up.

programme.title: WTAE Chronicle
programme.desc: Looking back on a decade of Chronicles at WTAE and revisiting some of the most impactful stories we’ve told about Pittsburghers.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.sub-title: Heroes On Call: The Forgotten Story of America's First Paramedics
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Chronicle: Legacy of Flight 427
programme.desc: (2024) Recounting the tragedy of US Airways Flight 427 that crashed in Beaver County, and talking with families and first responders 30 years later.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Esquire’s Dave Holmes chats with Girls5eva’s Busy Philipps. Dave and Busy play Travels and Tribulations, and Dave shares his Esquire-approved itinerary for things to do in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Makers, crafters and artists square off to create the most iconic art piece that best represents their city. From glass-blowers and chalk artists to metalsmiths and tattooers, see who Host Ashley Adams and the judges will crown the victor.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Maker Nation

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.desc: Plate It Picklesburgh
